column4: Nov 30 10:56:00 localhost xinetd[26348]: bind failed (Address already in use (errno = 98)). service = telnet
Nov 30 10:56:00 localhost xinetd[26348]: Service telnet failed to start and is deactivated.
Nov 30 10:56:00 localhost xinetd[26348]: bind failed (Address already in use (errno = 98)). service = telnet
Nov 30 10:56:00 localhost xinetd[26348]: Service telnet failed to start and is deactivated.
It appears you already have telnet running. That would be the reason it can't bind.
ok seems I am already on, but cannot telnet another session
can I stop the telnet session to rebind?
What reason do you have to rebind it? If it's already running, you should already be able to connect.
That's odd. Do you remember installing a telnet server before? Or did you specify it when you install the server?
xinetd isn't the only server you have installed it seems.
Do you have a telnet client running at the moment?
Close the client and restart the server.
I did this and no go
I'm at the end of my rope then, I'm unsure as to why it's unable to bind unless you already have a server running. You have to stop the other server before you can start the one you want to use.
